newsArray.title: England v Colombia: Women‚Äôs World Cup quarter-final ‚Äì live
creator: Sarah Rendell
newsArray.description: World Cup quarter-final, 11.30am BST/8.30pm AEST kick-offAustralia knock out France | Mail Sarah or tweet @rendellxHere are some of the players who could play a major part in the outcome of this quarter-final. Keep a close eye on Linda Caicedo, she has been one of the biggest stars so far in this tournament:Colombia have also gone early with their team news. They too have made one change with Manuela Vanegas returning from her suspension. Continue reading...
newsArray.content: Show key events only Please turn on JavaScript to use this feature Live feed Key events 14m ago Half time! England 1-1 Colombia 16m ago GOAL! England 1-1 Colombia (Hemp, 45+6') 23m ago GOAL! England 0-1 Colombia (Santos, 44') 1h ago Kick-off! England 0-0 Colombia 2h ago Colombia team news 3h ago England team news 3h ago Intro Show key events only Please turn on JavaScript to use this feature 1m ago 07.37 EDT England have equalised but Colombia‚Äôs strike is the goal of the match, this could be a nomination for goal of the tournament (the clip is from ITV and so some may not have access): üá®üá¥ INCREDIBLE FROM LEICY SANTOS! Santos lobs Mary Earps from an unlikely angle to give #COL the lead against England... #FIFAWWC pic.twitter.com/Pq041pVlZS ‚Äî ITV Football (@itvfootball) August 12, 2023 10m ago 07.28 EDT Enjoying the Guardian‚Äôs coverage of the Women‚Äôs World Cup? This action-packed, up-to-the-minute live blog is only possible thanks to funding from our fans all around the world. We don‚Äôt have a paywall, so everything we publish is open and free for everyone. Unlike so many others, the Guardian is fiercely independent ‚Äì meaning we don‚Äôt have a billionaire owner who can censor us. Fund quality sports journalism from the Guardian today from as little as ¬£1 . It takes less than a minute but makes a huge difference. Support the Guardian 12m ago 07.26 EDT Colombia were the better team on balance over that half, their defending overall was clinical and their attack was far more deadly. But an individual error from goalkeeper Perez has allowed England back into this match and at the perfect time. 14m ago 07.25 EDT Half time! England 1-1 Colombia Colombia found the opener with a superb Santos strike but England equalised just before the half! Everything to play for, what a match. Sign up for the Moving the Goalposts newsletter: our free women‚Äôs football email Read more Updated at 07.25 EDT 15m ago 07.24 EDT 45 + 7 min : The ball kept pinging around, Colombia just couldn‚Äôt clear their lines. Perez initially saved but she couldn‚Äôt control and Hemp strikes. 16m ago 07.23 EDT GOAL! England 1-1 Colombia (Hemp, 45+6') An error from Perez and Hemp is in! Perez and Carabali colide under pressure from Russo. Photograph: Cameron Spencer/Getty Images Hemp is on hand to tap in. Photograph: Lars Baron/Getty Images Updated at 07.32 EDT 18m ago 07.21 EDT 45 + 5 min : England have kept composure since going behind, they do need to put more pressure on Colombia to get something. But Colombia‚Äôs defence is so compact and clinical. Mary has said: ‚ÄúOh my lord, what a beautiful goal by Santos. England needs to get to halftime and regroup. Somehow England needs to slow the tempo down, and not allow Columbia to play chaos football, they seem to thrive in that manic tempo.‚Äù 20m ago 07.19 EDT 45 + 3 min : That was also the first goal England have conceded in open play, the other was a penalty against China. Bright passes to Stanway, who lays it off to Russo but it‚Äôs blocked. 21m ago 07.18 EDT 45 + 1 min : This will be interesting to see how England react here, this is the first time they have gone behind at this World Cup. There are six minutes added. 22m ago 07.17 EDT 45 min : Santos was a step into the box, her shot beats Daly and it bends into the top left corner. Earps tries to save but there‚Äôs nothing she can do about it. How about this! An upset on the cards! 23m ago 07.16 EDT GOAL! England 0-1 Colombia (Santos, 44') OH MY! It was coming and what a peach of a shot. Wow. Santos lifts the ball from the edge of the box. Photograph: Carl Recine/Reuters Keeper Earps gets lobbed. Photograph: Lars Baron/Getty Images Santos celebrates scoring. Photograph: Carl Recine/Reuters Colombia‚Äôs players celebrate with Santo. Photograph: Zac Goodwin/PA Updated at 07.28 EDT 24m ago 07.15 EDT 44 min : Vanegas connects with Caicedo but she is offside ‚Äì Colombia look more likely to score at the moment. They are having all the joy going forward, England‚Äôs last pass in the final third just not coming together. This time Bronze loses out to Vanegas but Bright comes to the rescue. 26m ago 07.13 EDT 42 min : Russo now has it in the box but D Arias sees it out. Toone wins a throw, she isn‚Äôt looking at her best in this one yet. Greenwood puts in a long range pass but it comes to Perez. 28m ago 07.11 EDT 40 min : Carabali pops it in, this time Earps collects. Colombia are doing well and have had more opportunities in the box, England get it so far and then Colombia repel their threat. 29m ago 07.10 EDT 39 min : Guzman lays it off to Ramirez and it comes back to the substitute. She pops it in and Caicedo gets to it, her shot is blocked. 30m ago 07.09 EDT 38 min : A bit of patient play now from England, this game has been all go. Russo loses the ball in the midfield though and here come Colombia! 31m ago 07.08 EDT 36 min : The free kick is short and then Greenwood pops it in but Vanegas beats Bright. Caicedo looks to peel away, Stanway fouls. 32m ago 07.06 EDT 35 min : Greenwood goes down again holding her face but I think she‚Äôs okay. Walsh taking on some instruction from Wiegman before we get back underway. Stanway with a great run but she is pulled back by Santos and England have a free kick. 34m ago 07.05 EDT 34 min : Guzman again has a beaut of a cross in but Bright heads away. England on the counter but Toone loses out to Carabali ‚Äì a frantic exchange at both ends! This is so entertaining! Greenwood hits the deck but play continues, she is eventually back to her feet and heads the ball away. It‚Äôs hard to keep up with all of this! 36m ago 07.03 EDT 32 min : Guzman with a great cross, she has been involved a lot since coming on, but no one in the box can connect. England are quick to work it up the other end but Toone‚Äôs touch isn‚Äôt clean and Colombia clear. 37m ago 07.02 EDT 31 min : Lauren Hemp that is beautiful. She is hounded on the line but she manages to get away and passes to Walsh but she boots the ball over the bar. Bright does well up the other end to prevent a ball coming to Ramirez. 38m ago 07.00 EDT 29 min : Daly takes a long range effort and it‚Äôs just over the bar! Carabali so good there to not concede a corner. Joe has emailed and said: ‚ÄúWatching from Indianapolis with a thunderstorm rumbling in the vicinity. But where is the snack chat? Your readers expect nothing less!‚Äù Oh you have some weather setting a mood! Apologies, I am slacking on my snack chat! Today I am eating cherry tomatoes, very odd I know! Daly shoots. Photograph: Cameron Spencer/Getty Images Updated at 07.22 EDT 40m ago 06.58 EDT 27 min : Greenwood is over the set piece ball and it‚Äôs a good delivery, Daly misses the header but it comes back in for her. The Aston Villa player‚Äôs header is straight at Perez. 42m ago 06.57 EDT 26 min : Bronze is wide open and it eventually come to her and she wins a corner. 42m ago 06.57 EDT 26 min : The free kick is taken short but England are ran back to halfway, a chance wasted but the Lionesses are still in possession. 43m ago 06.56 EDT 25 min : Daly is up and okay to continue. England have a free kick now as Guzman fouls Hemp but that time I think it shouldn‚Äôt be a foul? Bizarre. 44m ago 06.54 EDT 23 min : Bronze with a storming run but she is crowded by three defenders and eventually the Barcelona defender fouls. Guzman absolutely clatters Daly, no foul given again. Play is stopped as she needs some treatment. Daly is fouled by Guzman. Photograph: Rick Rycroft/AP Updated at 07.05 EDT 46m ago 06.53 EDT 22 min : Usme waits for the ball but Greenwood heads away. Hemp is taken out off the ball by Guzman but it‚Äôs not been given as a foul? Strange decision. Santos pings it in but England do enough to keep it out, frantic defence from England at the moment. 48m ago 06.51 EDT 20 min : Daly pops it in, it‚Äôs initially cleared and then Vanegas dispossess Carter. A long range pass from Bright has too much on it and we have a throw. No sign of a breather in this one. 50m ago 06.49 EDT 18 min : Colombia doing well to marshal England‚Äôs forwards and it pays off with Walsh misplacing a pass. Colombia come now and Ramirez, who is such a threat, has a good run but her pass doesn‚Äôt come off. A balanced game so far, Colombia with more chances but England‚Äôs looked the more deadly. 52m ago 06.47 EDT 16 min : Caicedo, how is she only 18?! She‚Äôs playing like a seasoned player! Unbelievable cut down the left to leave Carter in the dust, her resulting shot is over the bar. A reminder Caicedo has scored at three World Cups in a year ‚Äì two youth tournaments and this one! Caicedo eveades the efforts of Carter on the wing. Photograph: Bianca de Marchi/AAP Updated at 07.03 EDT 53m ago 06.45 EDT 14 min : Caicedo with a lovely run and she whips it to Usme. She lines up a huge shot, it‚Äôs blocked but great play. Greenwood calmly works it out ‚Äì she is so dependable at the back. 54m ago 06.44 EDT 13 min : Julian has got in touch and said: ‚ÄúAny idea why England are being booed by the crowd?‚Äù Because there are a lot of Colombia fans in, they like to create an atmosphere and will do what they can to help their team! England will also thrive on the great atmosphere. Back to the game and England have the ball and ae building from deep. Fans of Colombia show their support. Photograph: Lars Baron/Getty Images Meanwhile, a lion roars. Photograph: Dean Lewins/EPA Updated at 07.09 EDT 1h ago 06.43 EDT 12 min : Guzman is on for C Arias, such a big miss for Colombia but Guzman did have a big part in Colombia‚Äôs goal against Jamaica! Here come England again, a blistering ball in and she heads it ‚Äì Perez calmly collects. I can tell my hands are going to get tired in this one, so much action! 1h ago 06.41 EDT 10 min : I think C Arias is off, the medical team signalled to the bench she is out. Colombia are still with 10 and Bronze gets the ball in the box but it‚Äôs blocked. 1h ago 06.40 EDT 9 min : C Arias has limped to the sidelines, she doesn‚Äôt look happy. For now Colombia play with 10 as we get back underway. 1h ago 06.39 EDT 8 min : This doesn‚Äôt look good for C Arias, she is such a big player in this Colombian team so I hope she is okay to continue. She quite literally threw herself at the shot from Hemp. Arias lies on the ground after sustaining an injury. Photograph: Dean Lewins/EPA Updated at 06.59 EDT 1h ago 06.38 EDT 7 min : OH MY WORD! How, oh how, have England not scored?! Walsh the key cog to connect the team and it comes to Russo in the box, her shot is blocked but a superb but of defending, it drops for Hemp but it‚Äôs blocked again. MASSIVE. C Arias needs some treatment after that defensive effort. Russo has a shot which makes contact with the head of Arias. Photograph: Lars Baron/Getty Images Hemp‚Äôs ebound is also blocked. Photograph: Cameron Spencer/Getty Images Updated at 06.47 EDT 1 of 2 Next Oldest Oldest Topics Women's World Cup 2023 Women's World Cup Women's football England women's football team Colombia women's football team Reuse this content

newsArray.content: Luis Enrique, premi√®re ! Apr√®s une salve de matches amicaux, le technicien espagnol de 53 ans dirigera son premier match officiel √† la t√™te du PSG ce samedi (21h), face √† Lorient, lors de la premi√®re journ√©e de Ligue 1 . Ce sera bien √©videmment sans Kylian Mbapp√©, absent du groupe de 20 joueurs d√©voil√© ce samedi matin. Le crack de Bondy est mis √† l'√©cart par sa direction en raison de son refus de prolonger un contrat qui ne court que jusqu'en 2024 . Pouss√©s vers la sortie, Neymar et Marco Verratti manquent √©galement √† l'appel. ¬´ Il y a les mots, mais mes actes sont encore plus parlants. Mes actions montreront quelles sont mes id√©es ¬ª, expliquait ¬´Lucho¬ª vendredi , en conf√©rence de presse, au sujet de ses plans pour les deux joueurs. √Ä noter que le club √©voquait un ¬´ syndrome viral ¬ª pour expliquer l'absence du Br√©silien √† l'entra√Ænement vendredi. L'Italien, lui, a particip√© normalement √† la s√©ance avec le reste de ses co√©quipiers. Parmi les 20 joueurs retenus, on retrouve notamment huit des neuf recrues parisiennes de l'√©t√©. newsArray.title: Coupe du monde f√©minine de foot : la fin du r√™ve pour les Bleues, √©limin√©es par l'Australie aux tirs au but
newsArray.description: L'√©quipe de France d'Herv√© Renard prend la porte en quarts de la Coupe du monde face √† l'Australie au terme d‚Äôune interminable s√©ance de tirs au but.
newsArray.content: Jamais deux sans trois. Comme lors des deux derni√®res √©ditions de la Coupe du monde f√©minine, les Bleues ont pris la porte en quarts de finale. Elles ont √©t√© √©limin√©es par l'Australie ce samedi ( 0-0 ap, 6-7 aux t.a.b. ) √† Brisbane. Une interminable et mythique s√©ance d‚Äôailleurs. Les Australiennes d√©fieront l'Angleterre ou la Colombie en demies de ¬´leur¬ª Mondial, un stade de la comp√©tition que la France n'a atteint qu'une fois, en 2011, terminant √† la quatri√®me place. √Ä Brisbane, ce sont les Fran√ßaises qui ont le mieux d√©but√© la rencontre, moins tendues que les Australiennes. Diani a allum√© une premi√®re m√®che (8e) et quelques minutes plus tard, Lakrar a manqu√© une opportunit√© √©norme, √† quelques m√®tres du but, suite √† un centre-tir de Le Sommer (12e). Le Sommer maintenait la pression dans la foul√©e (28e) et Lakrar s'offrait encore une occasion en or (31e) juste avant que les Bleues ne disparaissent pendant plus de trente minutes. Jusque-l√† timor√©es, les Australiennes sortaient le bout de leur nez avant la pause. Suite √† une m√©sentente entre Karchaoui et Peyraud-Magnin, Fowler pensait ouvrir le score mais c'√©tait sans compter sur un sauvetage magnifique sur sa ligne de De Almeida (41e). Cela lan√ßait le match des Matildas. Au retour des vestiaires, les Australiennes acc√©l√©raient et asphyxiaient les Bleues pendant un gros quart d'heure et de nombreuses situations chaudes sur le but de Peyraud-Magnin. Fowler (50e, 60e) faisait √† nouveau frissonner les Tricolores avant que la rencontre ne tombe dans un faux rythme jusqu'√† la prolongation. √Ä VOIR AUSSI - La pr√©paration des Bleues avant le quart de finale face √† l‚ÄôAustralie Trente minutes suppl√©mentaires donc et trente minutes anim√©es avec un but refus√© pour les Bleues (100e). Un corner inexistant, tir√© par Bacha, √©tait donn√© aux Fran√ßaises et converti...par Kennedy dans son propre but mais les Australiennes allaient finalement √™tre sauv√©es par une faute de Renard sur Foord. Un tournant. Dans la foul√©e, Vine se montrait dangereuse (105e). Becho r√©agissait (107, 110e) sans r√©ussite. La d√©cision allait donc se faire aux tirs au but et pour l'exercice, Herv√© Renard fit le choix de changer de gardienne. Exit Pauline Peyraud-Magnin et place √† Sol√®ne Durand. Une s√©ance de tirs au but pleine de tension avec pas moins de dix tireuses de chaque c√¥t√©. Et √† deux reprises, Durand maintenait les Bleues en vie lors des premi√®res balles de match australiennes mais les Fran√ßaises manquaient la cible √† de trop nombreuses reprises (Bacha, Perisset, Dali) et la jeune Becho, dixi√®me tireuse, exp√©diait sa tentative sur le poteau d'Arnold, la gardienne australienne. Et cette fois-ci, Vine ne laissait pas passer la troisi√®me balle de match, envoyant ainsi l'Australie dans le dernier carr√© mondial pour la toute premi√®re fois.

newsArray.title: LIVE NRL: Roosters land ‚Äòbig blow‚Äô on stroke of halftime against ‚Äòbrave‚Äô Dolphins
newsArray.description: The Roosters have struck a ‚Äúblow‚Äù right on halftime, with Joey Manu crossing for the Chooks‚Äô first try of the night. They trail the Dolphins 8-6 at the break.
newsArray.content: The Roosters have struck a ‚Äúblow‚Äù right on halftime, with Joey Manu crossing for the Chooks‚Äô first try of the night. They trail the Dolphins 8-6 at the break. Ray Stone barged over from close range to break the deadlock after 25 minutes, with Jamayne Isaako adding a penalty goal ten minutes later. The Roosters have had quite a few opportunites at the Dolphins line, with the attacking woes that have plagued their season reappearing, but the away side have been brave in defense. Roosters fullback James Tedesco ran at the line and drew in a couple of Dolphins, before turning it back inside to the hard running Manu. ‚ÄúJoey Manu finally cracks this brave Dolphins defence and the Roosters land a big blow right on halftime,‚Äù Dan Ginnane said on Fox League. MATCH PREVIEW The Roosters will be desperate to keep their finals hopes alive on Saturday night when they face Wayne Bennett‚Äôs Dolphins. Trent Robinson‚Äôs side have given themself no room for error in the race for post-season football with a loss finishing their season. Drew Hutchison has been named at halfback, with Sandon Smith on the bench which could see the rookie shift in to dummy-half to replace Brandon Smith. Elsewhere, Dylan Napa returns to the NRL after signing with the Roosters mid-season. For the Dolphins, Kodi Nikorima lines up at fullback which has shifted Origin star Hamiso Tabuai-Fidow in to the centres. newsArray.title: What time do the Matildas play their semi final?
newsArray.description: The Matildas are into the semi-final of the FIFA Women‚Äôs World Cup for the first time in their history after a thrilling victory over France via a nailbiting penalty shootout.
newsArray.content: The Matildas are into the semi-final of the FIFA Women‚Äôs World Cup for the first time in their history after a thrilling victory over France via a nailbiting penalty shootout. Super-sub Cortnee Vine converted the winning penalty to spark jubilant scenes at Brisbane Stadium as the Matildas sealed a spot in the final four. Football fans across the nation now will be asking when and where the Matildas will play their next game. The Matildas will play their semi-final clash on Wednesday August 16, with kick-off schedule for 8pm AEST. The game will be played at Stadium Australia in Sydney, meaning yet another attendance record could be broken. The Matildas‚Äô opponent will be the winner of the quarterfinal between England and Colombia.

newsArray.title: Les Bleues √©limin√©es en quarts de la Coupe du monde apr√®s une s√©ance de tirs au but irrespirable face √† l'Australie
creator: S√©bastien Buron
newsArray.description: La France a √©t√© √©limin√©e en quarts de finale de la Coupe du monde apr√®s une s√©ance de tirs au but irrespirable, ce samedi, face √† l'Australie (0-0 a.p., 6-7 aux t.a.b.). Le r√™ve de d√©crocher le sacre mondial s'est envol√© pour les Bleues de Herv√© Renard.
newsArray.content: Le match : 0-0 a.p., 7-6 aux t.a.b. Elles sont tomb√©es de d√©tresse sur la pelouse et les regrets seront, forc√©ment, immenses apr√®s cette nouvelle d√©sillusion. L'√©quipe de France f√©minine esp√©rait d√©crocher son premier titre mondial cet √©t√© et elle devra toujours courir, dans quatre ans, apr√®s cet objectif. Face √† l'Australie, coorganisatrice de l'√©preuve avec la Nouvelle-Z√©lande, les Bleues ont vu leur r√™ve s'envoler au terme d'une s√©ance de tirs au but irrespirable (0-0 a.p., 6-7 aux t.a.b.). Le d√©but de rencontre laissait pourtant entrevoir une autre issue tant les joueuses de Herv√© Renard, malgr√© le jeu dur des Australiennes, se montraient sup√©rieures. √Ä la 35e minute, les statistiques traduisaient cette domination : 8 tirs √† 2 pour la France. Mais le score √©tait toujours de 0-0. Car Diani avait tir√© √† c√¥t√© (8e), Arnold avait repouss√© les tirs de Le Sommer (28e) et Lakrar (32e), et la d√©fenseuse avait surtout rat√© un but tout fait √† la 12e minute. La fin de la premi√®re p√©riode a annonc√© une bascule. De Almeida a sauv√© devant sa ligne un tir de Fowler apr√®s une m√©sentente entre Karchaoui et Peyraud-Magnin (41e), la gardienne fran√ßaise s'est ensuite interpos√©e devant l'attaquante australienne (45e) et le rapport de force a continu√© sur cette lanc√©e au retour des vestiaires. Fowler a vu sa frappe d√©vi√©e par De Almeida apr√®s une relance totalement rat√©e de Peyraud-Magnin (50e), tr√®s f√©brile jusque-l√†, mais d√©cisive ensuite par deux tr√®s belles parades sur des tentatives de Raso (56e) puis - encore - de Fowler (60e). Entre-temps, la star australienne Sam Kerr, pas encore √† 100 %, avait fait son entr√©e sur la pelouse (55e) et l'inqui√©tude pouvait grandir. Incapables de se cr√©er la moindre occasion toute la seconde p√©riode, les Bleues √©taient alors au bord du pr√©cipice. Bacha, P√©risset, Dali et Becho en √©chec Elles ont sorti la t√™te de l'eau en prolongation et ont m√™me cru ouvrir le score sur un csc de Kennedy, mais le but √©tait refus√© pour un tirage de maillot de Renard sur Foord (100e). Vine (105e), Becho (107e) √©taient √† leur tour proches du K.-O., Catley a r√©ussi un superbe sauvetage (110e), et Herv√© Renard a tent√© un immense coup en rempla√ßant Peyraud-Magnin par Sol√®ne Durand pour les tirs au but. Mais ses arr√™ts lors de la s√©ance fatidique n'auront pas suffi face aux √©checs de Bacha, P√©risset et Dali, qui avait pourtant pu retirer une deuxi√®me fois, et de Becho. Comme en 2015, face √† l'Allemagne (1-1 a.p., 4-5 aux t.a.b.), les Bleues ont craqu√© lors de la s√©ance fatidique. Un mois apr√®s avoir domin√© les Bleues en amical (1-0) le 14 juillet, jour de la F√™te Nationale en France, les Australiennes ont, dans la folie de Brisbane, pu c√©l√©brer leur premi√®re qualification de leur histoire pour les demi-finales de la Coupe du monde. 3 Pour la troisi√®me fois de suite, la France a √©t√© √©limin√©e en quarts de finale de la Coupe du monde f√©minine. Les Bleues n'ont atteint qu'une fois le dernier carr√©, en 2011. Elles avaient alors termin√© 4es.

newsArray.title: Harry Kane hints at future Tottenham return after finishing Bayern Munich transfer
creator: Mirza Shehnaz
newsArray.description: Sign as much as Miguel Delaney‚Äôs Reading the Game publication despatched straight to your inbox totally free Sign as much as Miguel‚Äôs Delaney‚Äôs free weekly publication England captain Harry Kane has left the door open for a return to Tottenham after finishing his ¬£100million transfer to Bayern Munich. Kane travelled to Germany on Friday for [...] The post Harry Kane hints at future Tottenham return after finishing Bayern Munich transfer appeared first on BusinessLend.
newsArray.content: England captain Harry Kane has left the door open for a return to Tottenham after finishing his ¬£100million transfer to Bayern Munich. Kane travelled to Germany on Friday for a medical and the Bundesliga giants confirmed on Saturday morning he had signed a deal till June 2027 and can put on the quantity 9 shirt. Spurs chairman Daniel Levy stated the membership had ‚Äúreluctantly‚Äù agreed to the transfer after Kane, who was within the final 12 months of his contract, made it clear he needed a recent problem. Kane stated in a message to Tottenham followers posted on his social media accounts: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not a goodbye because you never know how things pan out in the future, but it‚Äôs a thank you and I‚Äôll see you soon.‚Äù The 30-year-old informed his new membership‚Äôs web site that he hoped to play some half in Bayern‚Äôs DFB Super Cup match with RB Leipzig on Saturday evening as he appears to be like to win the primary trophy of his profession. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm very happy to be a part of FC Bayern now,‚Äù Kane stated. ‚ÄúBayern is one of the biggest clubs in the world and I‚Äôve always said that I want to compete and prove myself at the highest level during my career. This club is defined by its winning mentality ‚Äì it feels very good to be here. ‚ÄúI feel like it was the right step in my career to really push myself and test myself on the highest level so that‚Äôs why I‚Äôm here and I look forward to that challenge.‚Äù Shortly earlier than the deal was formally confirmed, Kane posted a message on social media wherein he thanked the followers and stated he had not needed to begin the season together with his future unresolved. ‚ÄúFrom the moment I‚Äôve been playing I‚Äôve been one of your own and I‚Äôve given everything that I possibly could to make you proud and give you as many special moments and memories to hopefully last forever,‚Äù Kane stated. ‚ÄúThis is a message to all you fans around the world, every single Tottenham fan that‚Äôs supported me and been with me throughout my journey. ‚ÄúMe and my family will cherish it forever, we‚Äôll never forget all the moments we‚Äôve had together so thank you. ‚ÄúI felt like it was the time to leave. I didn‚Äôt want to go into the season with a lot of unresolved future talk. ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs important for the new manager and the players to concentrate on trying to get Tottenham back to around the top of the table and fighting for trophies so I wish Ange (Postecoglou) and all the boys all the very best of luck. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be watching from a fan point of view now and really hope the team can be successful.‚Äù Postecoglou had revealed on Friday that Kane‚Äôs transfer was ‚Äúimminent‚Äù after a breakthrough in negotiations between the golf equipment was reached on Wednesday evening. It left the ball in Kane‚Äôs court docket and he selected Thursday to depart his boyhood membership for Bayern, who pays an preliminary ¬£100m with add-ons probably taking the deal as much as an total charge of ¬£120m, the PA information company understands. Kane leaves Tottenham having scored 280 targets to develop into the membership‚Äôs all-time main goalscorer, however with out a trophy. ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs important for the new manager and the players to concentrate on trying to get Tottenham back to around the top of the table and fighting for trophies so I wish Ange (Postecoglou) and all the boys all the very best of luck,‚Äù Kane stated. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be watching from a fan point of view now and really hope the team can be successful.‚Äù Bayern had seen their earlier bids for Kane turned down, however refused to surrender their pursuit of the 30-year-old, who stays 47 targets shy of equalling Alan Shearer‚Äôs Premier League file of 260. Harry was clear that he needed a recent problem and wouldn‚Äôt be signing a brand new contract this summer season Levy informed the membership‚Äôs web site: ‚ÄúWe sought over a long period of time to engage Harry and his representatives in several forms of contract extension, both short and long term. ‚ÄúHarry was clear, however, that he wanted a fresh challenge and would not be signing a new contract this summer. We have reluctantly, therefore, agreed to his transfer. ‚ÄúWe have seen a product of our academy system become one of the best players to ever pull on a Spurs shirt and become one of world football‚Äôs elite strikers. It has been a truly remarkable journey.‚Äù Harry Kane‚Äôs highs and lows at Tottenham as he indicators with Bayern Munich

newsArray.title: Les Bleues √©limin√©es de la Coupe du monde par l'Australie aux tirs au but
newsArray.description: La France affrontait l'Australie, ce samedi 12 ao√ªt, √† Brisbane, en quart de finale de la coupe du monde f√©minine. Les Bleues se sont inclin√©es aux tirs au but (6-7).
newsArray.content: Dans une premi√®re mi-temps plut√¥t timide, aucune des deux √©quipes n'est parvenue √† inscrire le moindre un but. Les Bleues ont toutefois maitris√© la majeure partie de ce premier acte avec quelques occasions, notamment d√®s la 7e minute de jeu : sur une mauvaise relance de l'Australienne Alanna Kennedy, la Fran√ßaise Kadidiatou Diani lui chipe la balle et l√¢che une frappe trop crois√©e, qui passe √† c√¥t√© de la cage. Premi√®re frayeur pour les Matildas. √Ä la 27e minute, il y a eu aussi ce tir de la num√©ro 9 tricolore, Eug√©nie Le Sommer, contr√© par la d√©fense et finalement repouss√© par la gardienne Mackenzie Arnold. Et puis c'est √† peu pr√®s tout ce que ce quart de finale avait √† offrir... Jusqu'au sauvetage miraculeux sur la ligne de but de l'arri√®re droit des Bleues, Elisa De Almeida. Apr√®s une incursion australienne dans la surface de r√©paration, et une m√©sentente entre la gardienne Pauline Peyraud-Magnin et Sakina Karchaoui, l'attaquante Mary Fowler d√©croche une frappe qui aurait d√ª finir au fond de la cage de but vide. Mais l'intervention spectaculaire de De Almeida permet de garder un score vierge √† la 45e minute. La deuxi√®me mi-temps aurait n√©anmoins pu √™tre fatale aux Bleues, face √† des Australiennes ultra dominantes, mais qui n'ont pas r√©ussi √† trouver le chemin des buts. D√®s l'entame du deuxi√®me acte, les Matildas ont pris d'assaut la surface de r√©paration tricolore. La premi√®re grosse occasion arrive √† la 55e minute de jeu, juste apr√®s l'entr√©e sur le terrain de la star australienne Sam Kerr, sous l'ovation des 49 000 spectateurs. √Ä l'entr√©e de la surface, Hayley Raso d√©clenche une frappe puissante qui est bien repouss√©e par Peyraud-Magnin. Peu de temps apr√®s, √† la 59e, l'attaquante Fowler se distingue √† nouveau, √† bout portant, mais trouve une nouvelle fois sur son chemin la gardienne fran√ßaise. C'est alors qu'Herv√© Renard d√©cide d'effectuer son premier changement du match (64e), avec l'entr√©e en jeu de Vicky Becho √† la place de Sandie Toletti. Les Bleues remettent un peu la t√™te √† l'endroit, et subissent un peu moins. Mais se procurent qu'une toute petite occasion en deuxi√®me mi-temps, loin d'√™tre suffisant pour forcer le destin en 90 minutes, ce qui a donc laiss√© place aux prolongations. Dans la premi√®re partie des prolongations, les Bleues pensaient que le plus difficile √©tait fait, apr√®s une t√™te contre son camp de Kennedy qui cherchait √† d√©fendre sur un corner (99e). Mais l'abrite siffle faute pour les Australiennes apr√®s un tirage de maillot de Wendie Renard dans la surface de r√©paration. √Ä la 104e, un centre tr√®s dangereux de l'Australienne Caitlin Foord pour Cortnee Vine, qui venait d'entrer en jeu, finit dans le petit filet ext√©rieur. Dans la deuxi√®me mi-temps des prolongations, une frappe de Becho (107e) se dirigeait vers la lucarne mais la gardienne a r√©alis√© une tr√®s jolie parade pour l'arr√™ter. A la 109e, c'est un centre fuyant de Grace Geyoro devant le but qui n'a pas n'a pas trouv√© de Bleues pour reprendre le ballon... Dans l'ensemble, les Fran√ßaises se sont montr√©es plus entreprenantes que les Australiennes dans les prolongations, mais pas suffisamment pour √©viter les tirs au but. Avant le dernier acte de la rencontre, √† la toute fin des prolongations, Herv√© Renard avait choisi de remplacer la gardienne Peyraud-Magnin par Sol√®ne Durand et de faire rentrer Eve P√©risset √† la place de De Almeida.

newsArray.title: England v Colombia: Women‚Äôs World Cup quarter-final ‚Äì live
creator: Sarah Rendell
newsArray.description: World Cup quarter-final, 11.30am BST/8.30pm AEST kick-offAustralia knock out France | Mail Sarah or tweet @rendellxHere are some of the players who could play a major part in the outcome of this quarter-final. Keep a close eye on Linda Caicedo, she has been one of the biggest stars so far in this tournament:Colombia have also gone early with their team news. They too have made one change with Manuela Vanegas returning from her suspension. Continue reading...
newsArray.content: Show key events only Please turn on JavaScript to use this feature Live feed Key events 14m ago Half time! England 1-1 Colombia 16m ago GOAL! England 1-1 Colombia (Hemp, 45+6') 23m ago GOAL! England 0-1 Colombia (Santos, 44') 1h ago Kick-off! England 0-0 Colombia 2h ago Colombia team news 3h ago England team news 3h ago Intro Show key events only Please turn on JavaScript to use this feature 1m ago 07.37 EDT England have equalised but Colombia‚Äôs strike is the goal of the match, this could be a nomination for goal of the tournament (the clip is from ITV and so some may not have access): üá®üá¥ INCREDIBLE FROM LEICY SANTOS! Santos lobs Mary Earps from an unlikely angle to give #COL the lead against England... #FIFAWWC pic.twitter.com/Pq041pVlZS ‚Äî ITV Football (@itvfootball) August 12, 2023 10m ago 07.28 EDT Enjoying the Guardian‚Äôs coverage of the Women‚Äôs World Cup? This action-packed, up-to-the-minute live blog is only possible thanks to funding from our fans all around the world. We don‚Äôt have a paywall, so everything we publish is open and free for everyone. Unlike so many others, the Guardian is fiercely independent ‚Äì meaning we don‚Äôt have a billionaire owner who can censor us. Fund quality sports journalism from the Guardian today from as little as ¬£1 . It takes less than a minute but makes a huge difference. Support the Guardian 12m ago 07.26 EDT Colombia were the better team on balance over that half, their defending overall was clinical and their attack was far more deadly. But an individual error from goalkeeper Perez has allowed England back into this match and at the perfect time. 14m ago 07.25 EDT Half time! England 1-1 Colombia Colombia found the opener with a superb Santos strike but England equalised just before the half! Everything to play for, what a match. Sign up for the Moving the Goalposts newsletter: our free women‚Äôs football email Read more Updated at 07.25 EDT 15m ago 07.24 EDT 45 + 7 min : The ball kept pinging around, Colombia just couldn‚Äôt clear their lines. Perez initially saved but she couldn‚Äôt control and Hemp strikes. 16m ago 07.23 EDT GOAL! England 1-1 Colombia (Hemp, 45+6') An error from Perez and Hemp is in! Perez and Carabali colide under pressure from Russo. Photograph: Cameron Spencer/Getty Images Hemp is on hand to tap in. Photograph: Lars Baron/Getty Images Updated at 07.32 EDT 18m ago 07.21 EDT 45 + 5 min : England have kept composure since going behind, they do need to put more pressure on Colombia to get something. But Colombia‚Äôs defence is so compact and clinical. Mary has said: ‚ÄúOh my lord, what a beautiful goal by Santos. England needs to get to halftime and regroup. Somehow England needs to slow the tempo down, and not allow Columbia to play chaos football, they seem to thrive in that manic tempo.‚Äù 20m ago 07.19 EDT 45 + 3 min : That was also the first goal England have conceded in open play, the other was a penalty against China. Bright passes to Stanway, who lays it off to Russo but it‚Äôs blocked. 21m ago 07.18 EDT 45 + 1 min : This will be interesting to see how England react here, this is the first time they have gone behind at this World Cup. There are six minutes added. 22m ago 07.17 EDT 45 min : Santos was a step into the box, her shot beats Daly and it bends into the top left corner. Earps tries to save but there‚Äôs nothing she can do about it. How about this! An upset on the cards! 23m ago 07.16 EDT GOAL! England 0-1 Colombia (Santos, 44') OH MY! It was coming and what a peach of a shot. Wow. Santos lifts the ball from the edge of the box. Photograph: Carl Recine/Reuters Keeper Earps gets lobbed. Photograph: Lars Baron/Getty Images Santos celebrates scoring. Photograph: Carl Recine/Reuters Colombia‚Äôs players celebrate with Santo. Photograph: Zac Goodwin/PA Updated at 07.28 EDT 24m ago 07.15 EDT 44 min : Vanegas connects with Caicedo but she is offside ‚Äì Colombia look more likely to score at the moment. They are having all the joy going forward, England‚Äôs last pass in the final third just not coming together. This time Bronze loses out to Vanegas but Bright comes to the rescue. 26m ago 07.13 EDT 42 min : Russo now has it in the box but D Arias sees it out. Toone wins a throw, she isn‚Äôt looking at her best in this one yet. Greenwood puts in a long range pass but it comes to Perez. 28m ago 07.11 EDT 40 min : Carabali pops it in, this time Earps collects. Colombia are doing well and have had more opportunities in the box, England get it so far and then Colombia repel their threat. 29m ago 07.10 EDT 39 min : Guzman lays it off to Ramirez and it comes back to the substitute. She pops it in and Caicedo gets to it, her shot is blocked. 30m ago 07.09 EDT 38 min : A bit of patient play now from England, this game has been all go. Russo loses the ball in the midfield though and here come Colombia! 31m ago 07.08 EDT 36 min : The free kick is short and then Greenwood pops it in but Vanegas beats Bright. Caicedo looks to peel away, Stanway fouls. 32m ago 07.06 EDT 35 min : Greenwood goes down again holding her face but I think she‚Äôs okay. Walsh taking on some instruction from Wiegman before we get back underway. Stanway with a great run but she is pulled back by Santos and England have a free kick. 34m ago 07.05 EDT 34 min : Guzman again has a beaut of a cross in but Bright heads away. England on the counter but Toone loses out to Carabali ‚Äì a frantic exchange at both ends! This is so entertaining! Greenwood hits the deck but play continues, she is eventually back to her feet and heads the ball away. It‚Äôs hard to keep up with all of this! 36m ago 07.03 EDT 32 min : Guzman with a great cross, she has been involved a lot since coming on, but no one in the box can connect. England are quick to work it up the other end but Toone‚Äôs touch isn‚Äôt clean and Colombia clear. 37m ago 07.02 EDT 31 min : Lauren Hemp that is beautiful. She is hounded on the line but she manages to get away and passes to Walsh but she boots the ball over the bar. Bright does well up the other end to prevent a ball coming to Ramirez. 38m ago 07.00 EDT 29 min : Daly takes a long range effort and it‚Äôs just over the bar! Carabali so good there to not concede a corner. Joe has emailed and said: ‚ÄúWatching from Indianapolis with a thunderstorm rumbling in the vicinity. But where is the snack chat? Your readers expect nothing less!‚Äù Oh you have some weather setting a mood! Apologies, I am slacking on my snack chat! Today I am eating cherry tomatoes, very odd I know! Daly shoots. Photograph: Cameron Spencer/Getty Images Updated at 07.22 EDT 40m ago 06.58 EDT 27 min : Greenwood is over the set piece ball and it‚Äôs a good delivery, Daly misses the header but it comes back in for her. The Aston Villa player‚Äôs header is straight at Perez. 42m ago 06.57 EDT 26 min : Bronze is wide open and it eventually come to her and she wins a corner. 42m ago 06.57 EDT 26 min : The free kick is taken short but England are ran back to halfway, a chance wasted but the Lionesses are still in possession. 43m ago 06.56 EDT 25 min : Daly is up and okay to continue. England have a free kick now as Guzman fouls Hemp but that time I think it shouldn‚Äôt be a foul? Bizarre. 44m ago 06.54 EDT 23 min : Bronze with a storming run but she is crowded by three defenders and eventually the Barcelona defender fouls. Guzman absolutely clatters Daly, no foul given again. Play is stopped as she needs some treatment. Daly is fouled by Guzman. Photograph: Rick Rycroft/AP Updated at 07.05 EDT 46m ago 06.53 EDT 22 min : Usme waits for the ball but Greenwood heads away. Hemp is taken out off the ball by Guzman but it‚Äôs not been given as a foul? Strange decision. Santos pings it in but England do enough to keep it out, frantic defence from England at the moment. 48m ago 06.51 EDT 20 min : Daly pops it in, it‚Äôs initially cleared and then Vanegas dispossess Carter. A long range pass from Bright has too much on it and we have a throw. No sign of a breather in this one. 50m ago 06.49 EDT 18 min : Colombia doing well to marshal England‚Äôs forwards and it pays off with Walsh misplacing a pass. Colombia come now and Ramirez, who is such a threat, has a good run but her pass doesn‚Äôt come off. A balanced game so far, Colombia with more chances but England‚Äôs looked the more deadly. 52m ago 06.47 EDT 16 min : Caicedo, how is she only 18?! She‚Äôs playing like a seasoned player! Unbelievable cut down the left to leave Carter in the dust, her resulting shot is over the bar. A reminder Caicedo has scored at three World Cups in a year ‚Äì two youth tournaments and this one! Caicedo eveades the efforts of Carter on the wing. Photograph: Bianca de Marchi/AAP Updated at 07.03 EDT 53m ago 06.45 EDT 14 min : Caicedo with a lovely run and she whips it to Usme. She lines up a huge shot, it‚Äôs blocked but great play. Greenwood calmly works it out ‚Äì she is so dependable at the back. 54m ago 06.44 EDT 13 min : Julian has got in touch and said: ‚ÄúAny idea why England are being booed by the crowd?‚Äù Because there are a lot of Colombia fans in, they like to create an atmosphere and will do what they can to help their team! England will also thrive on the great atmosphere. Back to the game and England have the ball and ae building from deep. Fans of Colombia show their support. Photograph: Lars Baron/Getty Images Meanwhile, a lion roars. Photograph: Dean Lewins/EPA Updated at 07.09 EDT 1h ago 06.43 EDT 12 min : Guzman is on for C Arias, such a big miss for Colombia but Guzman did have a big part in Colombia‚Äôs goal against Jamaica! Here come England again, a blistering ball in and she heads it ‚Äì Perez calmly collects. I can tell my hands are going to get tired in this one, so much action! 1h ago 06.41 EDT 10 min : I think C Arias is off, the medical team signalled to the bench she is out. Colombia are still with 10 and Bronze gets the ball in the box but it‚Äôs blocked. 1h ago 06.40 EDT 9 min : C Arias has limped to the sidelines, she doesn‚Äôt look happy. For now Colombia play with 10 as we get back underway. 1h ago 06.39 EDT 8 min : This doesn‚Äôt look good for C Arias, she is such a big player in this Colombian team so I hope she is okay to continue. She quite literally threw herself at the shot from Hemp. Arias lies on the ground after sustaining an injury. Photograph: Dean Lewins/EPA Updated at 06.59 EDT 1h ago 06.38 EDT 7 min : OH MY WORD! How, oh how, have England not scored?! Walsh the key cog to connect the team and it comes to Russo in the box, her shot is blocked but a superb but of defending, it drops for Hemp but it‚Äôs blocked again. MASSIVE. C Arias needs some treatment after that defensive effort. Russo has a shot which makes contact with the head of Arias. Photograph: Lars Baron/Getty Images Hemp‚Äôs ebound is also blocked. Photograph: Cameron Spencer/Getty Images Updated at 06.47 EDT 1 of 2 Next Oldest Oldest Topics Women's World Cup 2023 Women's World Cup Women's football England women's football team Colombia women's football team Reuse this content

newsArray.description: Luis Enrique a convoqu√© un groupe de 20 joueurs pour affronter Lorient ce samedi (21h), lors de la premi√®re journ√©e du championnat de France.
newsArray.content: Luis Enrique, premi√®re ! Apr√®s une salve de matches amicaux, le technicien espagnol de 53 ans dirigera son premier match officiel √† la t√™te du PSG ce samedi (21h), face √† Lorient, lors de la premi√®re journ√©e de Ligue 1 . Ce sera bien √©videmment sans Kylian Mbapp√©, absent du groupe de 20 joueurs d√©voil√© ce samedi matin. newsArray.content: England captain Harry Kane has left the door open for a return to Tottenham after finishing his ¬£100million transfer to Bayern Munich. Kane travelled to Germany on Friday for a medical and the Bundesliga giants confirmed on Saturday morning he had signed a deal till June 2027 and can put on the quantity 9 shirt. Spurs chairman Daniel Levy stated the membership had ‚Äúreluctantly‚Äù agreed to the transfer after Kane, who was within the final 12 months of his contract, made it clear he needed a recent problem. Kane stated in a message to Tottenham followers posted on his social media accounts: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not a goodbye because you never know how things pan out in the future, but it‚Äôs a thank you and I‚Äôll see you soon.‚Äù The 30-year-old informed his new membership‚Äôs web site that he hoped to play some half in Bayern‚Äôs DFB Super Cup match with RB Leipzig on Saturday evening as he appears to be like to win the primary trophy of his profession. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm very happy to be a part of FC Bayern now,‚Äù Kane stated. ‚ÄúBayern is one of the biggest clubs in the world and I‚Äôve always said that I want to compete and prove myself at the highest level during my career. This club is defined by its winning mentality ‚Äì it feels very good to be here. ‚ÄúI feel like it was the right step in my career to really push myself and test myself on the highest level so that‚Äôs why I‚Äôm here and I look forward to that challenge.‚Äù Shortly earlier than the deal was formally confirmed, Kane posted a message on social media wherein he thanked the followers and stated he had not needed to begin the season together with his future unresolved. ‚ÄúFrom the moment I‚Äôve been playing I‚Äôve been one of your own and I‚Äôve given everything that I possibly could to make you proud and give you as many special moments and memories to hopefully last forever,‚Äù Kane stated. ‚ÄúThis is a message to all you fans around the world, every single Tottenham fan that‚Äôs supported me and been with me throughout my journey. ‚ÄúMe and my family will cherish it forever, we‚Äôll never forget all the moments we‚Äôve had together so thank you. ‚ÄúI felt like it was the time to leave. I didn‚Äôt want to go into the season with a lot of unresolved future talk. ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs important for the new manager and the players to concentrate on trying to get Tottenham back to around the top of the table and fighting for trophies so I wish Ange (Postecoglou) and all the boys all the very best of luck. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be watching from a fan point of view now and really hope the team can be successful.‚Äù Postecoglou had revealed on Friday that Kane‚Äôs transfer was ‚Äúimminent‚Äù after a breakthrough in negotiations between the golf equipment was reached on Wednesday evening. It left the ball in Kane‚Äôs court docket and he selected Thursday to depart his boyhood membership for Bayern, who pays an preliminary ¬£100m with add-ons probably taking the deal as much as an total charge of ¬£120m, the PA information company understands. Kane leaves Tottenham having scored 280 targets to develop into the membership‚Äôs all-time main goalscorer, however with out a trophy. ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs important for the new manager and the players to concentrate on trying to get Tottenham back to around the top of the table and fighting for trophies so I wish Ange (Postecoglou) and all the boys all the very best of luck,‚Äù Kane stated. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be watching from a fan point of view now and really hope the team can be successful.‚Äù Bayern had seen their earlier bids for Kane turned down, however refused to surrender their pursuit of the 30-year-old, who stays 47 targets shy of equalling Alan Shearer‚Äôs Premier League file of 260. Harry was clear that he needed a recent problem and wouldn‚Äôt be signing a brand new contract this summer season Levy informed the membership‚Äôs web site: ‚ÄúWe sought over a long period of time to engage Harry and his representatives in several forms of contract extension, both short and long term. ‚ÄúHarry was clear, however, that he wanted a fresh challenge and would not be signing a new contract this summer. We have reluctantly, therefore, agreed to his transfer. ‚ÄúWe have seen a product of our academy system become one of the best players to ever pull on a Spurs shirt and become one of world football‚Äôs elite strikers. It has been a truly remarkable journey.‚Äù Harry Kane‚Äôs highs and lows at Tottenham as he indicators with Bayern Munich

newsArray.content: Show key events only Please turn on JavaScript to use this feature Live feed Key events 14m ago Half time! England 1-1 Colombia 16m ago GOAL! England 1-1 Colombia (Hemp, 45+6') 23m ago GOAL! England 0-1 Colombia (Santos, 44') 1h ago Kick-off! England 0-0 Colombia 2h ago Colombia team news 3h ago England team news 3h ago Intro Show key events only Please turn on JavaScript to use this feature 1m ago 07.37 EDT England have equalised but Colombia‚Äôs strike is the goal of the match, this could be a nomination for goal of the tournament (the clip is from ITV and so some may not have access): üá®üá¥ INCREDIBLE FROM LEICY SANTOS! Santos lobs Mary Earps from an unlikely angle to give #COL the lead against England... #FIFAWWC pic.twitter.com/Pq041pVlZS ‚Äî ITV Football (@itvfootball) August 12, 2023 10m ago 07.28 EDT Enjoying the Guardian‚Äôs coverage of the Women‚Äôs World Cup? This action-packed, up-to-the-minute live blog is only possible thanks to funding from our fans all around the world. We don‚Äôt have a paywall, so everything we publish is open and free for everyone. Unlike so many others, the Guardian is fiercely independent ‚Äì meaning we don‚Äôt have a billionaire owner who can censor us. Fund quality sports journalism from the Guardian today from as little as ¬£1 . It takes less than a minute but makes a huge difference. Support the Guardian 12m ago 07.26 EDT Colombia were the better team on balance over that half, their defending overall was clinical and their attack was far more deadly. But an individual error from goalkeeper Perez has allowed England back into this match and at the perfect time. 14m ago 07.25 EDT Half time! England 1-1 Colombia Colombia found the opener with a superb Santos strike but England equalised just before the half! Everything to play for, what a match. Sign up for the Moving the Goalposts newsletter: our free women‚Äôs football email Read more Updated at 07.25 EDT 15m ago 07.24 EDT 45 + 7 min : The ball kept pinging around, Colombia just couldn‚Äôt clear their lines. Perez initially saved but she couldn‚Äôt control and Hemp strikes. 16m ago 07.23 EDT GOAL! England 1-1 Colombia (Hemp, 45+6') An error from Perez and Hemp is in! Perez and Carabali colide under pressure from Russo. Photograph: Cameron Spencer/Getty Images Hemp is on hand to tap in. Photograph: Lars Baron/Getty Images Updated at 07.32 EDT 18m ago 07.21 EDT 45 + 5 min : England have kept composure since going behind, they do need to put more pressure on Colombia to get something. But Colombia‚Äôs defence is so compact and clinical. Mary has said: ‚ÄúOh my lord, what a beautiful goal by Santos. England needs to get to halftime and regroup. Somehow England needs to slow the tempo down, and not allow Columbia to play chaos football, they seem to thrive in that manic tempo.‚Äù 20m ago 07.19 EDT 45 + 3 min : That was also the first goal England have conceded in open play, the other was a penalty against China. Bright passes to Stanway, who lays it off to Russo but it‚Äôs blocked. 21m ago 07.18 EDT 45 + 1 min : This will be interesting to see how England react here, this is the first time they have gone behind at this World Cup. There are six minutes added. 22m ago 07.17 EDT 45 min : Santos was a step into the box, her shot beats Daly and it bends into the top left corner. Earps tries to save but there‚Äôs nothing she can do about it. How about this! An upset on the cards! 23m ago 07.16 EDT GOAL! England 0-1 Colombia (Santos, 44') OH MY! It was coming and what a peach of a shot. Wow. Santos lifts the ball from the edge of the box. Photograph: Carl Recine/Reuters Keeper Earps gets lobbed. Photograph: Lars Baron/Getty Images Santos celebrates scoring. Photograph: Carl Recine/Reuters Colombia‚Äôs players celebrate with Santo. Photograph: Zac Goodwin/PA Updated at 07.28 EDT 24m ago 07.15 EDT 44 min : Vanegas connects with Caicedo but she is offside ‚Äì Colombia look more likely to score at the moment. They are having all the joy going forward, England‚Äôs last pass in the final third just not coming together. This time Bronze loses out to Vanegas but Bright comes to the rescue. 26m ago 07.13 EDT 42 min : Russo now has it in the box but D Arias sees it out. Toone wins a throw, she isn‚Äôt looking at her best in this one yet. Greenwood puts in a long range pass but it comes to Perez. 28m ago 07.11 EDT 40 min : Carabali pops it in, this time Earps collects. Colombia are doing well and have had more opportunities in the box, England get it so far and then Colombia repel their threat. 29m ago 07.10 EDT 39 min : Guzman lays it off to Ramirez and it comes back to the substitute. She pops it in and Caicedo gets to it, her shot is blocked. 30m ago 07.09 EDT 38 min : A bit of patient play now from England, this game has been all go. Russo loses the ball in the midfield though and here come Colombia! 31m ago 07.08 EDT 36 min : The free kick is short and then Greenwood pops it in but Vanegas beats Bright. Caicedo looks to peel away, Stanway fouls. 32m ago 07.06 EDT 35 min : Greenwood goes down again holding her face but I think she‚Äôs okay. Walsh taking on some instruction from Wiegman before we get back underway. Stanway with a great run but she is pulled back by Santos and England have a free kick. 34m ago 07.05 EDT 34 min : Guzman again has a beaut of a cross in but Bright heads away. England on the counter but Toone loses out to Carabali ‚Äì a frantic exchange at both ends! This is so entertaining! Greenwood hits the deck but play continues, she is eventually back to her feet and heads the ball away. It‚Äôs hard to keep up with all of this! 36m ago 07.03 EDT 32 min : Guzman with a great cross, she has been involved a lot since coming on, but no one in the box can connect. England are quick to work it up the other end but Toone‚Äôs touch isn‚Äôt clean and Colombia clear. 37m ago 07.02 EDT 31 min : Lauren Hemp that is beautiful. She is hounded on the line but she manages to get away and passes to Walsh but she boots the ball over the bar. Bright does well up the other end to prevent a ball coming to Ramirez. 38m ago 07.00 EDT 29 min : Daly takes a long range effort and it‚Äôs just over the bar! Carabali so good there to not concede a corner. Joe has emailed and said: ‚ÄúWatching from Indianapolis with a thunderstorm rumbling in the vicinity. But where is the snack chat? Your readers expect nothing less!‚Äù Oh you have some weather setting a mood! Apologies, I am slacking on my snack chat! Today I am eating cherry tomatoes, very odd I know! Daly shoots. Photograph: Cameron Spencer/Getty Images Updated at 07.22 EDT 40m ago 06.58 EDT 27 min : Greenwood is over the set piece ball and it‚Äôs a good delivery, Daly misses the header but it comes back in for her. The Aston Villa player‚Äôs header is straight at Perez. 42m ago 06.57 EDT 26 min : Bronze is wide open and it eventually come to her and she wins a corner. 42m ago 06.57 EDT 26 min : The free kick is taken short but England are ran back to halfway, a chance wasted but the Lionesses are still in possession. 43m ago 06.56 EDT 25 min : Daly is up and okay to continue. England have a free kick now as Guzman fouls Hemp but that time I think it shouldn‚Äôt be a foul? Bizarre. 44m ago 06.54 EDT 23 min : Bronze with a storming run but she is crowded by three defenders and eventually the Barcelona defender fouls. Guzman absolutely clatters Daly, no foul given again. Play is stopped as she needs some treatment. Daly is fouled by Guzman. Photograph: Rick Rycroft/AP Updated at 07.05 EDT 46m ago 06.53 EDT 22 min : Usme waits for the ball but Greenwood heads away. Hemp is taken out off the ball by Guzman but it‚Äôs not been given as a foul? Strange decision. Santos pings it in but England do enough to keep it out, frantic defence from England at the moment. 48m ago 06.51 EDT 20 min : Daly pops it in, it‚Äôs initially cleared and then Vanegas dispossess Carter. A long range pass from Bright has too much on it and we have a throw. No sign of a breather in this one. 50m ago 06.49 EDT 18 min : Colombia doing well to marshal England‚Äôs forwards and it pays off with Walsh misplacing a pass. Colombia come now and Ramirez, who is such a threat, has a good run but her pass doesn‚Äôt come off. A balanced game so far, Colombia with more chances but England‚Äôs looked the more deadly. 52m ago 06.47 EDT 16 min : Caicedo, how is she only 18?! She‚Äôs playing like a seasoned player! Unbelievable cut down the left to leave Carter in the dust, her resulting shot is over the bar. A reminder Caicedo has scored at three World Cups in a year ‚Äì two youth tournaments and this one! Caicedo eveades the efforts of Carter on the wing. Photograph: Bianca de Marchi/AAP Updated at 07.03 EDT 53m ago 06.45 EDT 14 min : Caicedo with a lovely run and she whips it to Usme. She lines up a huge shot, it‚Äôs blocked but great play. Greenwood calmly works it out ‚Äì she is so dependable at the back. 54m ago 06.44 EDT 13 min : Julian has got in touch and said: ‚ÄúAny idea why England are being booed by the crowd?‚Äù Because there are a lot of Colombia fans in, they like to create an atmosphere and will do what they can to help their team! England will also thrive on the great atmosphere. Back to the game and England have the ball and ae building from deep. Fans of Colombia show their support. Photograph: Lars Baron/Getty Images Meanwhile, a lion roars. Photograph: Dean Lewins/EPA Updated at 07.09 EDT 1h ago 06.43 EDT 12 min : Guzman is on for C Arias, such a big miss for Colombia but Guzman did have a big part in Colombia‚Äôs goal against Jamaica! Here come England again, a blistering ball in and she heads it ‚Äì Perez calmly collects. I can tell my hands are going to get tired in this one, so much action! 1h ago 06.41 EDT 10 min : I think C Arias is off, the medical team signalled to the bench she is out. Colombia are still with 10 and Bronze gets the ball in the box but it‚Äôs blocked. 1h ago 06.40 EDT 9 min : C Arias has limped to the sidelines, she doesn‚Äôt look happy. For now Colombia play with 10 as we get back underway. 1h ago 06.39 EDT 8 min : This doesn‚Äôt look good for C Arias, she is such a big player in this Colombian team so I hope she is okay to continue. She quite literally threw herself at the shot from Hemp. Arias lies on the ground after sustaining an injury. Photograph: Dean Lewins/EPA Updated at 06.59 EDT 1h ago 06.38 EDT 7 min : OH MY WORD! How, oh how, have England not scored?! Walsh the key cog to connect the team and it comes to Russo in the box, her shot is blocked but a superb but of defending, it drops for Hemp but it‚Äôs blocked again. MASSIVE. C Arias needs some treatment after that defensive effort. Russo has a shot which makes contact with the head of Arias. Photograph: Lars Baron/Getty Images Hemp‚Äôs ebound is also blocked. Photograph: Cameron Spencer/Getty Images Updated at 06.47 EDT 1 of 2 Next Oldest Oldest Topics Women's World Cup 2023 Women's World Cup Women's football England women's football team Colombia women's football team Reuse this content

newsArray.title: Ligue 1 : le PSG sans Mbapp√© contre Lorient, Neymar et Verratti manquent √©galement √† l‚Äôappel
newsArray.description: Luis Enrique a convoqu√© un groupe de 20 joueurs pour affronter Lorient ce samedi (21h), lors de la premi√®re journ√©e du championnat de France.
newsArray.content: Luis Enrique, premi√®re ! Apr√®s une salve de matches amicaux, le technicien espagnol de 53 ans dirigera son premier match officiel √† la t√™te du PSG ce samedi (21h), face √† Lorient, lors de la premi√®re journ√©e de Ligue 1 . Ce sera bien √©videmment sans Kylian Mbapp√©, absent du groupe de 20 joueurs d√©voil√© ce samedi matin. Le crack de Bondy est mis √† l'√©cart par sa direction en raison de son refus de prolonger un contrat qui ne court que jusqu'en 2024 . Pouss√©s vers la sortie, Neymar et Marco Verratti manquent √©galement √† l'appel. ¬´ Il y a les mots, mais mes actes sont encore plus parlants. Mes actions montreront quelles sont mes id√©es ¬ª, expliquait ¬´Lucho¬ª vendredi , en conf√©rence de presse, au sujet de ses plans pour les deux joueurs. √Ä noter que le club √©voquait un ¬´ syndrome viral ¬ª pour expliquer l'absence du Br√©silien √† l'entra√Ænement vendredi. L'Italien, lui, a particip√© normalement √† la s√©ance avec le reste de ses co√©quipiers. Parmi les 20 joueurs retenus, on retrouve notamment huit des neuf recrues parisiennes de l'√©t√©. newsArray.title: Coupe du monde f√©minine de foot : la fin du r√™ve pour les Bleues, √©limin√©es par l'Australie aux tirs au but
newsArray.description: L'√©quipe de France d'Herv√© Renard prend la porte en quarts de la Coupe du monde face √† l'Australie au terme d‚Äôune interminable s√©ance de tirs au but.
newsArray.content: Jamais deux sans trois. Comme lors des deux derni√®res √©ditions de la Coupe du monde f√©minine, les Bleues ont pris la porte en quarts de finale. Elles ont √©t√© √©limin√©es par l'Australie ce samedi ( 0-0 ap, 6-7 aux t.a.b. ) √† Brisbane. Une interminable et mythique s√©ance d‚Äôailleurs. Les Australiennes d√©fieront l'Angleterre ou la Colombie en demies de ¬´leur¬ª Mondial, un stade de la comp√©tition que la France n'a atteint qu'une fois, en 2011, terminant √† la quatri√®me place. √Ä Brisbane, ce sont les Fran√ßaises qui ont le mieux d√©but√© la rencontre, moins tendues que les Australiennes. Diani a allum√© une premi√®re m√®che (8e) et quelques minutes plus tard, Lakrar a manqu√© une opportunit√© √©norme, √† quelques m√®tres du but, suite √† un centre-tir de Le Sommer (12e). Le Sommer maintenait la pression dans la foul√©e (28e) et Lakrar s'offrait encore une occasion en or (31e) juste avant que les Bleues ne disparaissent pendant plus de trente minutes. Jusque-l√† timor√©es, les Australiennes sortaient le bout de leur nez avant la pause. Suite √† une m√©sentente entre Karchaoui et Peyraud-Magnin, Fowler pensait ouvrir le score mais c'√©tait sans compter sur un sauvetage magnifique sur sa ligne de De Almeida (41e). Cela lan√ßait le match des Matildas. Au retour des vestiaires, les Australiennes acc√©l√©raient et asphyxiaient les Bleues pendant un gros quart d'heure et de nombreuses situations chaudes sur le but de Peyraud-Magnin. Fowler (50e, 60e) faisait √† nouveau frissonner les Tricolores avant que la rencontre ne tombe dans un faux rythme jusqu'√† la prolongation. √Ä VOIR AUSSI - La pr√©paration des Bleues avant le quart de finale face √† l‚ÄôAustralie Trente minutes suppl√©mentaires donc et trente minutes anim√©es avec un but refus√© pour les Bleues (100e). Un corner inexistant, tir√© par Bacha, √©tait donn√© aux Fran√ßaises et converti...par Kennedy dans son propre but mais les Australiennes allaient finalement √™tre sauv√©es par une faute de Renard sur Foord. Un tournant. Dans la foul√©e, Vine se montrait dangereuse (105e). Becho r√©agissait (107, 110e) sans r√©ussite. La d√©cision allait donc se faire aux tirs au but et pour l'exercice, Herv√© Renard fit le choix de changer de gardienne. Exit Pauline Peyraud-Magnin et place √† Sol√®ne Durand. Une s√©ance de tirs au but pleine de tension avec pas moins de dix tireuses de chaque c√¥t√©. Et √† deux reprises, Durand maintenait les Bleues en vie lors des premi√®res balles de match australiennes mais les Fran√ßaises manquaient la cible √† de trop nombreuses reprises (Bacha, Perisset, Dali) et la jeune Becho, dixi√®me tireuse, exp√©diait sa tentative sur le poteau d'Arnold, la gardienne australienne. Et cette fois-ci, Vine ne laissait pas passer la troisi√®me balle de match, envoyant ainsi l'Australie dans le dernier carr√© mondial pour la toute premi√®re fois.

newsArray.content: The Roosters have struck a ‚Äúblow‚Äù right on halftime, with Joey Manu crossing for the Chooks‚Äô first try of the night. They trail the Dolphins 8-6 at the break. Ray Stone barged over from close range to break the deadlock after 25 minutes, with Jamayne Isaako adding a penalty goal ten minutes later. The Roosters have had quite a few opportunites at the Dolphins line, with the attacking woes that have plagued their season reappearing, but the away side have been brave in defense. newsArray.title: What time do the Matildas play their semi final?
newsArray.description: The Matildas are into the semi-final of the FIFA Women‚Äôs World Cup for the first time in their history after a thrilling victory over France via a nailbiting penalty shootout.
newsArray.content: The Matildas are into the semi-final of the FIFA Women‚Äôs World Cup for the first time in their history after a thrilling victory over France via a nailbiting penalty shootout. Super-sub Cortnee Vine converted the winning penalty to spark jubilant scenes at Brisbane Stadium as the Matildas sealed a spot in the final four. Football fans across the nation now will be asking when and where the Matildas will play their next game. The Matildas will play their semi-final clash on Wednesday August 16, with kick-off schedule for 8pm AEST. The game will be played at Stadium Australia in Sydney, meaning yet another attendance record could be broken. The Matildas‚Äô opponent will be the winner of the quarterfinal between England and Colombia.

newsArray.title: Les Bleues √©limin√©es en quarts de la Coupe du monde apr√®s une s√©ance de tirs au but irrespirable face √† l'Australie
creator: S√©bastien Buron
newsArray.description: La France a √©t√© √©limin√©e en quarts de finale de la Coupe du monde apr√®s une s√©ance de tirs au but irrespirable, ce samedi, face √† l'Australie (0-0 a.p., 6-7 aux t.a.b.). Le r√™ve de d√©crocher le sacre mondial s'est envol√© pour les Bleues de Herv√© Renard.
newsArray.content: Le match : 0-0 a.p., 7-6 aux t.a.b. Elles sont tomb√©es de d√©tresse sur la pelouse et les regrets seront, forc√©ment, immenses apr√®s cette nouvelle d√©sillusion. L'√©quipe de France f√©minine esp√©rait d√©crocher son premier titre mondial cet √©t√© et elle devra toujours courir, dans quatre ans, apr√®s cet objectif. Face √† l'Australie, coorganisatrice de l'√©preuve avec la Nouvelle-Z√©lande, les Bleues ont vu leur r√™ve s'envoler au terme d'une s√©ance de tirs au but irrespirable (0-0 a.p., 6-7 aux t.a.b.). La fin de la premi√®re p√©riode a annonc√© une bascule. Vine (105e), Becho (107e) √©taient √† leur tour proches du K.-O., Catley a r√©ussi un superbe sauvetage (110e), et Herv√© Renard a tent√© un immense coup en rempla√ßant Peyraud-Magnin par Sol√®ne Durand pour les tirs au but. Mais ses arr√™ts lors de la s√©ance fatidique n'auront pas suffi face aux √©checs de Bacha, P√©risset et Dali, qui avait pourtant pu retirer une deuxi√®me fois, et de Becho. Comme en 2015, face √† l'Allemagne (1-1 a.p., 4-5 aux t.a.b.), les Bleues ont craqu√© lors de la s√©ance fatidique. Un mois apr√®s avoir domin√© les Bleues en amical (1-0) le 14 juillet, jour de la F√™te Nationale en France, les Australiennes ont, dans la folie de Brisbane, pu c√©l√©brer leur premi√®re qualification de leur histoire pour les demi-finales de la Coupe du monde. 3 Pour la troisi√®me fois de suite, la France a √©t√© √©limin√©e en quarts de finale de la Coupe du monde f√©minine. Les Bleues n'ont atteint qu'une fois le dernier carr√©, en 2011. Elles avaient alors termin√© 4es.

newsArray.content: England captain Harry Kane has left the door open for a return to Tottenham after finishing his ¬£100million transfer to Bayern Munich. Kane travelled to Germany on Friday for a medical and the Bundesliga giants confirmed on Saturday morning he had signed a deal till June 2027 and can put on the quantity 9 shirt. Spurs chairman Daniel Levy stated the membership had ‚Äúreluctantly‚Äù agreed to the transfer after Kane, who was within the final 12 months of his contract, made it clear he needed a recent problem. Kane stated in a message to Tottenham followers posted on his social media accounts: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not a goodbye because you never know how things pan out in the future, but it‚Äôs a thank you and I‚Äôll see you soon.‚Äù The 30-year-old informed his new membership‚Äôs web site that he hoped to play some half in Bayern‚Äôs DFB Super Cup match with RB Leipzig on Saturday evening as he appears to be like to win the primary trophy of his profession. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm very happy to be a part of FC Bayern now,‚Äù Kane stated. ‚ÄúBayern is one of the biggest clubs in the world and I‚Äôve always said that I want to compete and prove myself at the highest level during my career. This club is defined by its winning mentality ‚Äì it feels very good to be here. ‚ÄúI feel like it was the right step in my career to really push myself and test myself on the highest level so that‚Äôs why I‚Äôm here and I look forward to that challenge.‚Äù Shortly earlier than the deal was formally confirmed, Kane posted a message on social media wherein he thanked the followers and stated he had not needed to begin the season together with his future unresolved. ‚ÄúFrom the moment I‚Äôve been playing I‚Äôve been one of your own and I‚Äôve given everything that I possibly could to make you proud and give you as many special moments and memories to hopefully last forever,‚Äù Kane stated. ‚ÄúThis is a message to all you fans around the world, every single Tottenham fan that‚Äôs supported me and been with me throughout my journey. ‚ÄúMe and my family will cherish it forever, we‚Äôll never forget all the moments we‚Äôve had together so thank you. ‚ÄúI felt like it was the time to leave. I didn‚Äôt want to go into the season with a lot of unresolved future talk. ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs important for the new manager and the players to concentrate on trying to get Tottenham back to around the top of the table and fighting for trophies so I wish Ange (Postecoglou) and all the boys all the very best of luck. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be watching from a fan point of view now and really hope the team can be successful.‚Äù Postecoglou had revealed on Friday that Kane‚Äôs transfer was ‚Äúimminent‚Äù after a breakthrough in negotiations between the golf equipment was reached on Wednesday evening. It left the ball in Kane‚Äôs court docket and he selected Thursday to depart his boyhood membership for Bayern, who pays an preliminary ¬£100m with add-ons probably taking the deal as much as an total charge of ¬£120m, the PA information company understands. Kane leaves Tottenham having scored 280 targets to develop into the membership‚Äôs all-time main goalscorer, however with out a trophy. ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs important for the new manager and the players to concentrate on trying to get Tottenham back to around the top of the table and fighting for trophies so I wish Ange (Postecoglou) and all the boys all the very best of luck,‚Äù Kane stated. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be watching from a fan point of view now and really hope the team can be successful.‚Äù Bayern had seen their earlier bids for Kane turned down, however refused to surrender their pursuit of the 30-year-old, who stays 47 targets shy of equalling Alan Shearer‚Äôs Premier League file of 260. Harry was clear that he needed a recent problem and wouldn‚Äôt be signing a brand new contract this summer season Levy informed the membership‚Äôs web site: ‚ÄúWe sought over a long period of time to engage Harry and his representatives in several forms of contract extension, both short and long term. ‚ÄúHarry was clear, however, that he wanted a fresh challenge and would not be signing a new contract this summer. We have reluctantly, therefore, agreed to his transfer. ‚ÄúWe have seen a product of our academy system become one of the best players to ever pull on a Spurs shirt and become one of world football‚Äôs elite strikers. It has been a truly remarkable journey.‚Äù Harry Kane‚Äôs highs and lows at Tottenham as he indicators with Bayern Munich
